Inference: Frequent rain-triggered pauses indicate a consistently wet climate
Description: Repeated rainfall interruptions suggest natural precipitation occurs regularly.
short rationale: Pure climate signal; no person-level behavior implied.

Inference: Infrequent rain-triggered pauses indicate a predominantly dry climate
Description: Long stretches without rain detections show minimal rainfall events.
short rationale: Dryness indicator only; no link to identity or behavior.

Inference: Clusters of rain detections over short periods suggest heavy rainfall episodes
Description: Multiple pauses happening close together imply dense or prolonged rain events.
short rationale: Weather intensity insight only; no personal exposure.

Inference: Long gaps between rain detections indicate extended dry spells
Description: Large intervals without rain-triggered adjustments reflect ongoing lack of precipitation.
short rationale: Dry spell marker; no user or identity signal.

Inference: Sudden bursts of rain detections indicate unexpected or intense storms
Description: Rapid sequences of rain-related pauses point to abrupt, heavy rainfall.
short rationale: Storm event signal; minimal privacy impact.

Inference: Gradual increase in rain detections indicates transition into a wetter season
Description: Increasing pause frequency signals climatic shifts toward higher rainfall.
short rationale: Seasonal climate trend only; no person-level data.

Inference: Gradual decrease in detections indicates movement into a drier season
Description: Fewer rain-related pauses reflect seasonal reduction in precipitation.
short rationale: Seasonal drying cue; no behavioral detail.

Inference: Rain detections consistently timed in certain months reveal seasonal rainfall patterns
Description: Clustering of detections during specific months indicates established rainy periods.
short rationale: Month-specific rain pattern can hint geography/season but still climate-level.

Inference: Rain detections on consecutive days indicate multi-day rainfall periods
Description: Back-to-back pauses imply rains lasting more than one day.
short rationale: Multi-day weather pattern; no individual behavior.

Inference: Single isolated rain detection events suggest sporadic, light rain patterns
Description: One-off detections indicate occasional or weak rainfall.
short rationale: Isolated weather event only; negligible privacy risk.

Inference: Frequent short-duration pauses suggest light or intermittent rainfall
Description: Many small interruptions imply drizzle or brief rain events.
short rationale: Drizzle frequency signal; no personal exposure.

Inference: Fewer but longer-duration pauses indicate heavy sustained rainfall
Description: Long pauses reflect concentrated and intense rainfall episodes.
short rationale: Heavy rain duration insight; no user data.

Inference: Rain detections concentrated in early mornings suggest morning rainfall patterns
Description: Time-based clustering reveals that rainfall peaks during early hours.
short rationale: Time-of-day climate signature that weakly hints at locale/timezone.

Inference: Rain detections concentrated at night indicate nighttime rainfall
Description: Nighttime pauses imply rain typically occurs during darker periods.
short rationale: Nighttime timing can hint local climate but not individuals.

Inference: Rain detections occurring immediately after irrigation cycles indicate sensitivity to light rain
Description: Rain may begin right after watering, or sensors may react to early droplets.
short rationale: Ties rain signals to irrigation schedule, revealing watering timing/response.

Inference: Long delays between rainfall events suggest stable dry microclimate
Description: Sparse detections show extended rain-free periods.
short rationale: Local dryness cue; no person-level detail.

Inference: Rapid repeat detections after a pause suggest intermittent stop–start rainfall
Description: Rain begins, stops briefly, and resumes, causing multiple interruptions.
short rationale: Stop-start rain behavior only; no behavioral signal.

Inference: Uniform rain detection across all zones indicates property-wide rainfall
Description: Simultaneous zone pauses imply rainfall is evenly distributed.
short rationale: Even coverage weather cue; minimal personal detail.

Inference: Zone-specific detection variations indicate micro-rainfall patterns
Description: Some areas detect rain while others do not, suggesting uneven precipitation.
short rationale: Microclimate differences expose some site layout/context but not identity.

Inference: Increasing frequency of pauses suggests approaching rainy season peaks
Description: More frequent rain detections reflect intensifying seasonal patterns.
short rationale: Seasonal ramp-up insight; no user behavior.

Inference: Decreasing frequency of detections suggests rainy season end
Description: Declining rates reflect movement toward drier climate phases.
short rationale: Seasonal tapering clue; minimal privacy impact.

Inference: High frequency of short pauses suggests drizzle-prone conditions

short rationale: Light-rain tendency only; no personal exposure.

Inference: Long-duration pauses suggest saturating rainfall conditions

short rationale: Sustained rainfall cue; no user or identity signal.

Inference: Sudden detection after long dry periods indicates major weather shift

Inference: Frequent alternation of detections and non-detections indicates unstable weather
Description: On–off rainfall patterns reflect rapid atmospheric shifts.
short rationale: Volatile weather pattern; no behavioral data.

Inference: Sparse but long detections resemble monsoon-like patterns
Description: Few rain events, but each is intense and prolonged.
short rationale: Monsoon-like signature may hint region but limited to climate.

Inference: Lack of rain detection during historically rainy periods suggests sensor issues
Description: Absence of expected detections may indicate sensor malfunction or misalignment.
short rationale: Suggests device malfunction/maintenance state, mildly operational.

Inference: Frequent very short detections imply hypersensitive sensor behavior
Description: Sensor may detect even minimal droplets or mist as rain.
short rationale: Reveals sensor calibration/placement; limited privacy impact.

Inference: Long periods with uninterrupted irrigation indicate dry climate tendencies
Description: Few rain interruptions show persistent dryness.
short rationale: Dry-climate signal; no person-level behavior.

Inference: Multiple detections soon after system installation imply rainy installation period

short rationale: Connects conditions to install timing, exposing setup activity window.

short rationale: Season onset indicator; no user behavior.

Inference: Consistency of long pauses suggests major rainfall impacts

short rationale: Rain impact level only; no personal information.

Inference: Detections occurring right after irrigation attempts may indicate mist interference

short rationale: Links detections to watering actions, revealing irrigation timing/behavior.
